fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true that 58% of Covid-19 deaths in Scotland were in care homes
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared Facebook post wrongly claims that 58% of Scotland’s coronavirus deaths took place in care homes.

fact_check_explanation_title: This letter claiming to be from a doctor in Surrey is full of errors
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about hospital attendance figures, death certificates, and empty ambulances are all false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mark Francois did not deny that there is a gender pay gap
fact_check_explanation_summary: This quote appears to be a fabrication.

fact_check_explanation_title: When did lockdown begin in the UK?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Matt Hancock claimed lockdown began a week before Boris Johnson instructed the country to ‘stay at home’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mirror claims NHS staff work 11 hours unpaid overtime on average but it’s probably more like two hours
fact_check_explanation_summary: NHS staff survey data suggests the average respondent in 2019 worked around two hours unpaid overtime. Even this should be taken with a pinch of salt.

fact_check_explanation_title: WhatsApp Gold scams are real, but these other threats are made up
fact_check_explanation_summary: Misinformation claiming a malicious WhatsApp video called Dance of the Pope will install software and format your phone has been going viral since at least 2015.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pressing ‘cancel’ does not prevent cash machine fraud
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is a common myth that pressing cancel before using a cash machine will prevent fraud

fact_check_explanation_title: A post incorrectly claims to show Australian warships turning away people trying to enter the country illegally
fact_check_explanation_summary: While Australia does turn back boats, this image does not show that action.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true the BBC decided against showing Dame Vera Lynn’s funeral live
fact_check_explanation_summary: Widely shared posts on Facebook wrongly claim the BBC decided not to broadcast Dame Vera Lynn’s funeral live, but did broadcast live the funeral of George Floyd.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why a Facebook post about an elderly lady looking for her Scottish niece keeps going viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no reason to doubt the original story is genuine, but people have been reposting it for several months.

fact_check_explanation_title: Not all Tesco meat is halal
fact_check_explanation_summary: According to the retailer, it sells halal meat in some of its stores.

fact_check_explanation_title: Cohabiting grandparents cannot bubble with a couple and their grandchildren
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister suggested that grandparents could bubble with the household of their grandchildren. This isn’t always allowed.
